title: Liverpool squad get down to work in Tenerife at week-long warm weather training camp
text:
Fun in the sun for Klopp and the gang (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool have got down to work at their week-long warm weather training camp in Tenerife. 
Jurgen Klopp has taken his squad - minus the Reds' international contingent - to sunnier climbs to be put through their paces as they prepare for the Premier League run-in. 
The team are staying at the Tenerife Top Training centre which has two natural grass pitches and a specific goalkeeper training pitch, alongside two gyms, a pair of swimming pools, tennis courts and a spa. 
The site has previously hosted Manchester City, Newcastle, Everton and Swansea. James Milner leads the way (Photo: Liverpool FC) Lovren claims the ball (Photo: Liverpool FC) Youngsters Adam Lewis and Kevin Stewart alongside Dejan Lovren (Photo: Liverpool FC) Read More Henderson travels with youthful Reds squad to Tenerife in bid to be fit for derby 
Acadamy starlets Adam Lewis, Yan Dhanda and Sheyi Ojo are among the young players to have made the trip, as has sipper Jordan Henderson who is continuing his rehabilitation from injury. 
Henderson faces a race against time to be fit for Liverpool's next outing which is the Merseyside derby on April 1 and was joined by senior team-mates James Milner, Lucas Leiva, Dejan Lovren and Loris Karius, among others. Klopp is all smiles in the sunshine (Photo: Liverpool FC) Alberto Moreno keeps his eyes on the ball (Photo: Liverpool FC) Toni Gomes also made the trip (Photo: Liverpool FC) The squad are putting in the hard yards in Tenerife (Photo: Liverpool FC) Read More 
The Reds currently sit in fourth place of the Premier League table, four points ahead of their bitter rivals Manchester United, who are in fifth. Lovren and Lucas limber up (Photo: Liverpool FC) Loris Karius will be hoping to impress Klopp (Photo: Liverpool FC) Looks nice there, doesn't it? (Photo: Liverpool FC) 
Klopp's men are a point behind third-placed Manchester City, but have played a game more as they get set for a run-in in which they will be looking to secure a Champions League spot next season.
